result.execSummary:
The defendant Kara A. Denault was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CM468, 14CF286, and 14CF248 called together at 10:56am
[Cases 14CF286 and 14CF248 Sentencing After Revocation; Case 15CM468 Plea/Sentencing]
Defendant, Kara A. Denault in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM468:
ADA Hall orally motions to amend the charging language in Count #6 to reflect "a cigar box" to "store" instead of "needle" to "inject"

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 and #6 as amended; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2, #3,  #4 and #5

As to Cases 14CF286, and 14CF248:
Counsel verifies receipt of revocation order
--Atty. Rhiel makes some corrections

As to all Cases sentencing arguments given
Statement made by Ms. Denault

As to Case 14CF248: 
The Court sentences Ms. Denault   to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years &   6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  years &  6  months.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes, as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to pay all statutory court costs



As to Case 14CF286:
On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to 9 months in the county jail to be served concurrent to the sentence in Case 14CF248
On Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant to 90 days is the county jail concurrent to the sentence in Count #2
On Count #4, the Court sentences the Defendant to 9 months in the county jail concurrent to the sentence in Counts #2 and #3

All outstanding court costs related to case 14CF286 are converted to civil judgment

As to Case 15CM468:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to serve 45 days in jail, consecutive to the sentence in 14CF248, to be served in the Prison system
On Count #6, the Court sentences the Defendant to serve 10 days in jail,consecutive to be served in the Prison system

The Court orders all statutory court costs and they are all court costs related to case 15CM468 are to be coverted to civil judgment

Days Credit:
14CF248=194 days
14CF286= 194 days
15CM468= 0 days
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 12:25pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-25-2016 11:00 am

[MK] cases #15CM468, #14CF248, #14CF286 called at 9:27am. 
Defendant Kara A. Denault in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Cases #14CF248 and #14CF286 are scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today, however Attorney Rhiel requests adjournment of these cases. Attorney Rhiel explains that he was recently appointed and needs further time to prepare.
The Court adjourns as to Cases #14CF248 and #14CF286.

As to Case #15CM468, Adjourned Initial Appearance is held: 
--Service of the Criminal Complaint is admitted; reading is waived.
--Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered. Speedy trial right is waived.
--The Bond is continued.
 recess 9:30am.

Cases 15CM468, 14CF248 & 14CF286 called together at 2:26 pm [Clerk SH] (Case 15CM468 was set for AIA & Cases 14CF248 & 286 for SEHR)
Defendant Kara A. Denault in court, in-custody, with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes informs the Court of conflict in these matters; did inform SPD ASAP and they indicated they would get new counsel appointed
Court allows Atty Humes to withdraw and requests that she inform SPD so new counsel gets appointed quickly
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Humes indicates that she believes new counsel could be ready in a week to 10 days

Cases 14CF248 & 14CF286 called together at 8:36 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kara A. Denault in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Count #2-14CF248 & Counts #2, #3 & #4-14CF286, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail (On Ct#2-14CF286), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 2/1/15 by 7:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment (Assessment within 60 days of release from jail) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least once per month for the first 6 months, then per Agent)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No possession or consumption of any illegal drugs
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To pay costs of $268 (Ct#2-14CF248)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (Ct#2-14CF248)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $75 drug testing fee to JESO (Ct#2-14CF248)
--To pay cost of $729 (each count in 14CF286)
--To pay $600 DNA Sucharge ($200 each count 14CF286)
--No contact with any know drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Cases 14CF248 & 14CF286 called together at 2:17 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kara A. Denault in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the domestic abuse enhancer on Count #2-14CF286
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #4-14CF286 to misdemeanor bailjumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(a), a class A misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2-14CF248 & Counts #2, #3 & #4-14CF286; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining counts in each case
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement for case 14CF286
Court reminds Ms. Denault that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Atty Luchsinger orally motions for bond modification; Court informs parties to submit stipulation
Recess: 2:30 pm

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:25pm. 
Defendant Kara A. Denault appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD eligibility determination is pending).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Denault verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is accurate.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge in Count #1 and its maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with her sister Kelsey Denault
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--not to make any acts or threats of violence toward anyone. 

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 2:32pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 9/5/14 at 11:00am (same date/time as Ms. Denault's other pending case; JA- please note in comments that recitation of the misdemeanor charges and maximum penalties is needed)
